items.sentence: I don't think you need to tell Tom why you went Australia last month.
I don't think that I need to tell Tom that Mary wants him to do that.
I don't think that I could stand to spend three hours alone with Tom.
I suspect Tom and Mary know something interesting is about to happen.
I suspect Tom and Mary were surprised when John walked into the room.
Tom told me that he thought that I might be interested in doing that.
Tom wanted Mary to do that, but she told him that she wouldn't do it.
Tom didn't seem surprised when Mary told him that she had to do that.
Maybe Tom should consider the possibility Mary has left him for good.
There's a possibility that Tom won't want to go to Australia with us.
Tom told me he thought that Mary would be present at today's meeting.
The Greeks landed on the Italian peninsula in the eighth century B.C.
Tom asked me how I kept from getting nervous in front of an audience.
Tom wanted to stay single, but his parents wanted him to get married.
We lay in the grass holding hands and watched the clouds floating by.
Tom said that he had some things that he needed to get off his chest.
The pirates lost their patience with Tom and made him walk the plank.
Tell me one reason why I should trust Tom after what he's done to me.
We waited half an hour at the library for Tom, but he didn't turn up.
If you don't get out of my store, I'm going to have to call the cops.
